subject: [junit] Problem in accessing the sub modules
msgSnippet: Hi, Iam novice to Junit, iam doing testing for Struts framework extending classes to MockStrutsTestCase, I developed an aplliaction in which i have many sub
messageBody:
Hi,

Iam novice to Junit, iam doing testing for Struts framework extending classes to MockStrutsTestCase, I developed an aplliaction in which i have many sub modules, for each sub module i mentioned a seperate
struts-config.xml. This i defined in web.xml as below along with original struts-config.xml

<servlet>
<servlet-name>ActionServlet</servlet-name>
<servlet-class>co.inf.web.base.ActionServlet</servlet-class>

<init-param>
<param-name>config</param-name>
<param-value>/WEB-INF/struts-config.xml</param-value>
</init-param>

<!-- module configurations -->

<init-param>
<param-name>config/mod</param-name>
<param-value>
/WEB-INF/modules/mod/struts-config.xml,
</param-value>
</init-param>

</servlet>

Iam able to test the action paths of struts-config.xml which are directly under WEB-INF but iam unable to access the struts-config.xml inside the module mod.
I tried in many ways by changing the setConfigFile path by refering some of the tutorials but of no use.

The test case which i tried is below:

package jutest.module;
import servletunit.struts.MockStrutsTestCase;
public class TestModuleActionPaths extends MockStrutsTestCase {
public TestModActionPaths(String testName) {
super(testName);
}
/**
* Testcase for checking the action paths
*
*/
public void testActionPaths() {

setConfigFile("mod",
"/WEB-INF/modules/mod/struts-config.xml");

setRequestPathInfo("/mod","/modQueryDispatch.action");
actionPerform();
verifyForward("query");

}
}



Thanking you,
Patil.
